TI: [Effect of destruction of the frontal and parietal regions of the neocortex on the ability of dogs to solve extrapolation problems].
AB: Parietoectomized dogs (n = 8), like intact ones (n = 102), are able to extrapolate the direction of the movement of an alimentary stimulus when presented with a complex task variant. In this they differ from animals with a prefrontal lobectomy (n = 10) in which, according to the authors' previous data (1971), the ability to elementary rational activity in Krushinsky extrapolation test (1977), is impaired.
TT: Vliianie razrusheniia lobnoi i temennoi oblastei neokorteksa na sposobnost' resheniia ekstrapoliatsionnoi zadachi u sobak.
TA: Zh Vyssh Nerv Deiat Im I P Pavlova
JT: Zhurnal vysshei nervnoi deiatelnosti imeni I P Pavlova
SO: Zh Vyssh Nerv Deiat Im I P Pavlova. 1979 May-Jun;29(3):537-42.
